Detailed Description

Author:
Jean Sapristi
Date:
15 janvier 2012

Define Documentation

#define PIZ_LINKLIST_FLAG_NONE   (0L)

Don't free items.

#define PIZ_LINKLIST_FLAG_FREE_MEMORY   (1<<0)

(DEFAULT) Free items with free().

#define PIZ_LINKLIST_FLAG_FREE_GROWING_ARRAY   (1<<1)

Free items with pizGrowingArrayFree().

Function Documentation

PIZLinklist* pizLinklistNew ( void   ) 

Create the linklist.

In case of failure the pointer is NULL.

Returns:
A pointer to the new linklist.

void pizLinklistSetFlags ( PIZLinklist *  x,
long  flags 
)

Set linklist's bit flags.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
flags Bit flags.

void pizLinklistFree ( PIZLinklist *  x  ) 

Free the linklist.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer. Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A Pointer.

void pizLinklistClear ( PIZLinklist *  x  ) 

Clear the linklist.

Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.

PIZError pizLinklistAppend ( PIZLinklist *  x,
void *  ptr 
)

Append an item's pointer to the linklist.

The provided pointer can not be NULL.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
ptr A pointer to the item.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizLinklistInsert ( PIZLinklist *  x,
void *  ptr 
)

Insert an item's pointer in front of the linklist.

The provided pointer can not be NULL.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
ptr A pointer to the item.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizLinklistPtrAtIndex ( PIZLinklist *  x,
long  index,
void **  ptr 
)

Get an item's pointer with specified index.

If there is no item at the index, pointer is set to NULL.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
index The index (zero-based).
ptr The adress of the pointer to set.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizLinklistNextByPtr ( PIZLinklist *  x,
void *  ptr,
void **  nextPtr 
)

Get the next item's pointer of a given item's pointer.

If there is no item next, pointer is set to NULL.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
ptr The item's pointer provided.
nextPtr The adress of the pointer to set.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
The following shows how to traverse a linklist using cache optimization. 
 PIZNote *note       = NULL;
 PIZNote *nextNote   = NULL;

 pizLinklistPtrAtIndex (linklist, 0, (void **)&note);

 while (note) {
      pizLinklistNextByPtr (linklist, (void *)note, (void **)&nextNote);

      //pizLinklistRemoveByPtr (linklist, (void *)note)); 

      note = nextNote;
 }

PIZError pizLinklistRemoveByPtr ( PIZLinklist *  x,
void *  ptr 
)

Given an item's pointer, remove this item from the linklist.

Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
ptr The item's pointer provided.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizLinklistSwapByIndexes ( PIZLinklist *  x,
long  m,
long  n 
)

Swap item's pointers in the linklist according to specified indexes.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
m Item's index (zero-based).
n Item's index (zero-based).
Returns:
An error code.

Get the number of items in the linklist.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The number of items.
